title: Homes Now Typically Sell in a Week, Forcing Buyers to Take Risks
sub_head: Buyers are often waiving traditional safeguards in fast-moving market where median price has climbed
body:
American home buyers are having to pounce faster than ever to clinch a deal, forcing many of them to make snap decisions about what house to purchase and where to live.
Home sales between July 2020 and June 2021 sat on the market for a median period of only one week before going under contract, according to a survey released Thursday by the National Association of Realtors. Thatâ€™s down from three weeks a year earlier and marks a record low in data going back to 1989.
